channel.title: Comments on: A New Kind of Resolution

item.title: By: martha
item.dc:creator: martha
item.description:
Tom, thanks for the pointer, will check it out. Sounds like either way I win.
However I must admit that I'm equally excited about the fact that your comment means that my ever-flowing wisdom is not blocked by the Chinese government & therefore readable there. You're welcome, China!
item.content:encoded:
Tom, thanks for the pointer, will check it out. Sounds like either way I win.

However I must admit that I’m equally excited about the fact that your comment means that my ever-flowing wisdom is not blocked by the Chinese government & therefore readable there. You’re welcome, China!

item.title: By: Tom
item.dc:creator: Tom
item.description:
For meditation, someone recommended to me a book called "Real Happiness." He then mentioned you can skip the book and download the audio files and it's just as good ( http://www.workman.com/static/realhappinessebook/ ). If you feel bad about downloading the audio files and not paying, you can probably try to meditate away the stress. If it works you're all set, and if it doesn't work, then you can be glad you didn't pay for them.
I tried listening to the first one and I fell asleep. I'm not sure if that means it worked or it didn't.
item.content:encoded:
For meditation, someone recommended to me a book called “Real Happiness.” He then mentioned you can skip the book and download the audio files and it’s just as good ( http://www.workman.com/static/realhappinessebook/ ). If you feel bad about downloading the audio files and not paying, you can probably try to meditate away the stress. If it works you’re all set, and if it doesn’t work, then you can be glad you didn’t pay for them.

I tried listening to the first one and I fell asleep. I’m not sure if that means it worked or it didn’t.
